study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of maternal dietary interventions, including plant polyphenols, in preventing cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic (CKM) syndrome in offspring.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that plant polyphenols are among the dietary strategies considered for preventing CKM syndrome in offspring, but specific results regarding their efficacy are not detailed. The review emphasizes the need for further research to translate these findings clinically.
population_specificity: Offspring at risk of CKM syndrome due to maternal dietary factors.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine whether polyphenols from Jaboticaba could mitigate exercise-induced oxidative stress and vascular dysfunction.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding polyphenols' effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate sex-specific differences in gut microbiota composition and interactions with cardiometabolic parameters after polyphenol supplementation in individuals with overweight/obesity.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenol supplementation influenced microbiota composition and cardiometabolic parameters, with sex-specific differences observed. However, specific efficacy outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 19 women and 18 men with normal glucose tolerance and BMI >25 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of polyphenols, vitamins, and selenium in reducing reactive stress and their role in preventing age-related diseases.
results_summary: The study suggests that polyphenols, along with vitamins A, C, E, and selenoproteins, may help reduce reactive stress and slow down diseases associated with aging by modulating SIRT1 and NRF2 pathways.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on human diseases and aging).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to evaluate the potential of common buckwheat (CBW) as a functional food component, focusing on its nutritional and health benefits.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding polyphenols' effects, only mentioning CBW's growing popularity as a functional food.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in understanding how anthocyanins (a subclass of polyphenols) modulate cellular and molecular mechanisms involved in intestinal dysfunction and inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that anthocyanins inhibit proinflammatory pathways (NF-κB, JNK, MAPK, STAT3, TLR4), upregulate the Nrf2 transcription factor, and enhance the expression of tight junction proteins and mucins, thereby reducing intestinal inflammation and dysfunction.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human diet context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a polyphenol-rich Rosa multiflora petal extract (RoseFit™) could effectively promote weight loss and improve metabolic markers in overweight individuals.
results_summary: The study found that RoseFit significantly reduced body weight, BMI, body fat percentage, and fat mass while maintaining lean mass. It also increased serum leptin levels, reduced ghrelin levels, and improved lipid profiles, indicating appetite suppression and metabolic benefits.
population_specificity: Overweight male and female subjects aged 20-50 years with a BMI of 25-30 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether blackcurrant supplementation combined with habitual physical activity improves functional capacity and quality of life in sedentary older women.
results_summary: Blackcurrant supplementation improved walking distance (12.3%), sit-to-stand time (16%), and quality of life (39%) after three months compared to placebo, with no changes in balance.
population_specificity: Sedentary, healthy older women (mean age ~73 years).
effective_dosage: 400 mg of blackcurrant extract (two capsules daily).
study_duration: One week and three months (with a one-week washout).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the health benefits, molecular mechanisms, and potential applications of secoiridoids (a group of polyphenols) from Olea europaea L.
results_summary: The study found that secoiridoids from Olea europaea L exhibit anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, cardioprotective, neuroprotective, and anticancer activities, suggesting multiple health benefits.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility of a trial assessing the effects of polyphenol supplementation on NAFLD and vascular parameters in obese adolescents.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study design but does not report results, as it is a protocol for a future trial.
population_specificity: Obese adolescents aged 12-18 years with hepatic steatosis (n=60).
effective_dosage: One time per day (specific amount not stated).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the role of polyphenols in mitigating exercise-induced muscle damage, focusing on oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding polyphenols' effects on muscle damage, soreness, or function.
population_specificity: Athletes and recreational exercisers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-exercise mangiferin-quercetin supplementation enhances athletic performance in high-level male basketball players during a basketball exercise simulation test.
results_summary: The study compared the effects of mangiferin-quercetin (84 mg/140 mg) versus placebo on heart rate, circuit and sprint times, and blood lactate levels during a basketball exercise simulation test. Results suggested potential performance enhancement, though specific statistical outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: High-level male basketball players (n=38, divided into EXP=19 and CON=19).
effective_dosage: 84 mg mangiferin and 140 mg quercetin, administered once one hour before exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and discuss the contribution of food-derived polyphenols in regulating inflammation from gene expression to physiological responses during systemic inflammation.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that polyphenols, among other dietary supplements, have immuno-modulating, anticoagulating, and analgesic properties that may help regulate inflammation in systemic conditions like sepsis. However, specific results or outcomes related to polyphenols alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Critically ill patients with systemic inflammation (e.g., sepsis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of polyphenols, among other compounds, in modifying the microbiome to reduce the incidence of radiation-induced mucositis in head and neck cancer patients.
results_summary: Polyphenols, along with fatty acids and probiotics, were found to promote commensal bacteria diversity and reduce the incidence of ulcerative mucositis, suggesting potential benefits in immunonutrition strategies. However, evidence remains limited, and large studies are needed to confirm efficacy.
population_specificity: Head and neck cancer patients undergoing radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the mechanism of action of polyphenols in modulating autophagy and their involvement in pathways such as mTOR, AMPK, SIRT-1, and ERK, particularly in the context of neurodegeneration.
results_summary: Polyphenols were found to improve autophagy by clearing misfolded proteins in neurons, suppress neuroinflammation and oxidative stress, and protect against neurodegeneration. They increase levels of autophagic proteins like beclin-1, LC3 I and II, and SIRT1, though the exact interaction with autophagy markers remains unclear.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on neurodegeneration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biological properties of seaweed metabolites, including polyphenols, and their potential benefits for human health, particularly skin and hair well-being, as well as their industrial applications.
results_summary: The study found that seaweed polyphenols exhibit antibacterial, antiviral, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory properties, making them suitable for food supplements and nutricosmetic products. The review also highlighted the potential for recovering these metabolites from algae biomass used in wastewater treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human health focus, particularly skin and hair).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of polyphenol supplementation on executive functions in overweight and/or obese populations at risk of cognitive impairment.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a non-significant effect of polyphenol supplementation on executive function (g = 0.076, CI = -0.018 to 0.170), though some primary studies suggested a potential positive effect in younger at-risk populations. Variability in executive function tasks and inadequate reporting of phenolic composition were noted limitations.
population_specificity: Overweight and/or obese adults at risk of cognitive impairment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether microencapsulated cocoa supplementation could reduce endothelial dysfunction caused by eccentric exercise in healthy subjects.
results_summary: The study evaluated flow-mediated dilatation (FMD), blood flow, and muscle oxygenation, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effectiveness of the intervention.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers (n=13)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of sumac (a polyphenol-rich supplement) combined with a calorie-restricted diet on appetite and metabolic markers in overweight and obese women with depression.
results_summary: Sumac supplementation significantly reduced appetite scores, leptin, NPY, insulin, FBS, and HOMA-IR while increasing QUICKI compared to placebo, suggesting improved appetite regulation and metabolic health.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese women with depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of daily consumption of 50 g of raisins (a polyphenol-rich food) for 6 months on cognitive performance, cardiovascular risk factors, and inflammation markers in older adults without cognitive impairment.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as it describes a planned study rather than completed findings.
population_specificity: Older adults without cognitive impairment, recruited from urban health centers in Salamanca and Zamora, Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the chronic effects of a polyphenol-rich olive fruit water phytocomplex (OliPhenolia®) on exercise performance and respiratory recovery markers in recreationally active individuals.
results_summary: OliP supplementation improved running economy, reduced perceived exertion, and enhanced acute recovery markers during aerobic exercise, though time to exhaustion improvements were not statistically significant compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Recreationally active adults (mean age 42 ± 2 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on polyphenols' bioavailability, their role in exercise-induced oxidative stress, antioxidant status, and supplementation strategies in athletes.
results_summary: The study found insufficient evidence to unequivocally support polyphenol supplementation for athletes, noting a lack of clear benefits for reducing oxidative stress or enhancing performance, and highlighted the need for further research.
population_specificity: Athletes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of polyphenols on pregnancy-associated complications, specifically preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, and fetal growth restriction.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenol intake has a protective effect against preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, and fetal growth restriction, though results varied based on experimental models, polyphenol types, dosages, and administration regimens.
population_specificity: Pregnant individuals (human and animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of grape polyphenols in regulating metabolic and molecular pathways to prevent and treat obesity, aging, and related muscle comorbidities.
results_summary: Grape polyphenols showed relevant and direct effects in cell culture and animal studies, but clinical studies validating these results in humans are scarce. The abstract highlights promising preclinical outcomes but emphasizes the need for clinical validation.
population_specificity: Cell culture and animal models (specific human population not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of polyphenol supplements on exercise-induced oxidative stress, inflammation control, and exercise performance.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplements showed high potency in improving redox homeostasis and muscle function, with 11 of 15 studies reporting reduced oxidative stress and inflammation markers. However, only 4 of 8 studies found improvements in exercise performance outcomes.
population_specificity: Athletes or individuals undergoing acute physical exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a polyphenol-rich dietary supplement containing Pinus massoniana bark extract (PMBE) could modulate blood pressure in healthy Australian adults aged 55-75 years.
results_summary: The supplement significantly reduced systolic blood pressure (SBP) by 3.29 mmHg at 12 weeks, with greater reductions (-6.46 mmHg) in individuals with normal-high SBP (>120 mmHg) and non-medicated individuals (-7.49 mmHg SBP, -3.06 mmHg DBP). No significant changes were observed in diastolic blood pressure (DBP) or individuals with optimal SBP (≤120 mmHg).
population_specificity: Healthy Australian adults aged 55-75 years.
effective_dosage: 1322 mg PMBE daily (50 mL dietary supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate how dietary intake of polyphenols in different forms might influence the oxidation of LDL and their potential role in reducing atherosclerosis.
results_summary: Polyphenols showed promising antioxidant properties in preclinical studies, reducing LDL oxidation, but clinical evidence was inconclusive. Mechanisms included lowering circulating cholesterol, incorporation into LDL particles, and enhancing systemic antioxidant activity, though results varied by population and supplement type.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties and potential industrial applications of micro- and macroalgae metabolites, including polyphenols, focusing on their nutraceutical, pharmacological, and biomedical benefits.
results_summary: The study highlights polyphenols among other algae-derived compounds as having significant potential for use in food, chemical, and pharmacological industries due to their antioxidant, antimicrobial, antitumor, and immunomodulatory properties. However, specific clinical outcomes or efficacy data for polyphenols alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research on algae metabolites).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the modulatory effects of polyphenols on gut microbiota and their potential role in improving metabolic disorders through the production of short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs).
results_summary: The study found that polyphenols modulate gut microbiota, promote beneficial bacteria, and increase SCFA production, which may help mitigate metabolic disorders like obesity and type 2 diabetes. The effects were supported by in vivo studies, suggesting a potential therapeutic role for polyphenols.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on metabolic disorders)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of oxidative stress in microglia and astrocytes in neuroinflammation and neurodegeneration and discuss potential benefits of antioxidant supplementation strategies.
results_summary: The abstract highlights age-related glial dysfunction, oxidative stress, and neuroinflammation but does not provide specific results on polyphenols' effects. It suggests antioxidant supplementation may be beneficial but lacks detailed findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of aging-related glial changes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of resveratrol supplementation during pregnancy and lactation to reduce maternal and offspring cardio-metabolic disorders.
results_summary: The study found that resveratrol supplementation was associated with reduced risks of maternal obesity, gestational diabetes, and preeclampsia, as well as diminished cardio-metabolic disorders in offspring. Emerging evidence suggests it modulates adaptive responses involving phenotypical plasticity.
population_specificity: Pregnant and lactating women and their offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of fruit-derived polyphenol intakes on cognition and lung function in healthy adults.
results_summary: The meta-analysis indicated a protective effect on lung function from dietary intakes of fruit-derived polyphenols, but no significant benefit or decrement was detected for cognition. More conclusive results are needed for polyphenol supplementation recommendations.
population_specificity: Healthy adults under 70 years old.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether combining 600 mg of bergamot phytosome with polyphenols could improve lipid profile modulation in subjects who did not respond adequately to bergamot alone.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that bergamot is effective in modulating lipid profiles, but some subjects did not achieve satisfactory results. The study investigated whether adding polyphenols could enhance efficacy, though specific results are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Subjects with hypercholesterolemia who did not respond adequately to bergamot supplementation.
effective_dosage: 600 mg of bergamot phytosome (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the interaction between tea polyphenols and gut microbiota and its role in the variability of cardiometabolic effects among individuals.
results_summary: The study found that tea polyphenols have low bioavailability and their metabolism is highly dependent on individual gut microbiota, leading to inconsistent cardiometabolic effects. The interaction between tea polyphenols and gut microbiota is not fully understood, and more research is needed to identify specific bacteria and metabolites involved.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of dietary polyphenols to counteract obesity-induced maternal reprogramming and protect offspring from metabolic disorders.
results_summary: Polyphenols demonstrated anti-obesity effects through antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities, counteracting the adverse effects of maternal obesity on offspring and reducing fetal predisposition to obesity. Some polyphenols were found to cross the placenta, offering protective benefits.
population_specificity: Offspring of obese mothers (animal or human study not specified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the metabolic profile of (-)-epicatechin metabolites (SREMs) after single-dose and sustained consumption of polyphenol-rich cocoa powder.
results_summary: SREMs concentrations increased significantly after both single-dose (1741 ± 337 nM) and sustained supplementation (1445 ± 270 nM), with sulfate conjugates showing higher levels in females. The study concluded that the SREMs profile after 28-day supplementation was comparable to that after a single dose.
population_specificity: Healthy young adults (18-40 years, 11 males and 9 females).
effective_dosage: 1.3 g of polyphenol-rich cocoa powder daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent clinical studies on the anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects of anthocyanins (a type of polyphenol) in both healthy individuals and those with chronic diseases.
results_summary: The review found evidence supporting anthocyanins' role in regulating pro-inflammatory markers, though inconsistencies between RCTs and meta-analyses were noted. Long-term clinical trials are needed to better quantify their effects on inflammation progression.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals and those with chronic diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of polyphenols and other bioactive compounds in modulating AQP5 activity to alleviate dry eye and mouth symptoms in Sjögren's syndrome patients.
results_summary: The study suggests that polyphenol-rich supplementation, alongside butyrate-producing diets, may help improve dry eye and mouth symptoms by influencing gut microbiota and AQP5 activity, though clinical evidence is preliminary.
population_specificity: Sjögren's syndrome patients with lower Firmicutes/Bacteroides (F/B) community ratio phenotype.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the antioxidant and neuroprotective effects of polyphenols in the context of ischemic stroke.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenols exhibit significant antioxidant potential, effectively inhibiting reactive oxygen species generation and oxidative stress, which contributes to neuroprotection after ischemic stroke.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of experimental studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent literature on the use of combined polyphenols in managing osteoarthritis, focusing on preclinical models and clinical trials.
results_summary: The study found that combined polyphenols show promise for osteoarthritis treatment, with anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, but more clinical trials are needed to understand their synergistic effects.
population_specificity: Patients with osteoarthritis and preclinical osteoarthritis models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if spectrophotometric measurement of fecal proanthocyanidin (PA) content could serve as a valid biomarker for PA intake in preclinical and observational settings.
results_summary: The study found a significant association between PA intake and fecal excretion in a preclinical study but no such relationship in an observational study, suggesting fecal PA measurement may be useful for compliance monitoring in controlled settings but not for assessing intake in free-living subjects.
population_specificity: Preclinical study subjects and free-living participants in an observational study.
effective_dosage: Not specified (excretion levels of 250-400 mg PA polymer equivalents/100 g feces during supplementation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of curcuminoids (a type of polyphenol) on inflammatory and oxidative stress biomarkers, clinical outcomes, and nutritional status in critically ill patients with traumatic brain injury (TBI).
results_summary: Curcuminoid supplementation significantly reduced serum levels of inflammatory markers (IL-6, TNF-α, MCP-1, CRP) and improved clinical outcomes (APACHEII and NUTRIC scores) compared to placebo, but no significant changes were observed in oxidative stress markers (GPx, SOD).
population_specificity: Critically ill adult patients with TBI admitted to the ICU.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether anthocyanin (a type of polyphenol) from food sources or extracts promotes beneficial changes in gut microbiota composition, metabolites, and intestinal barrier parameters.
results_summary: Anthocyanin supplementation demonstrated positive effects on intestinal health, including improvements in gut microbiota composition and physical barrier parameters, based on 27 animal model studies. The analysis followed PRISMA guidelines and assessed risk of bias using the SYRCLE tool.
population_specificity: Animal models (specific species not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antiviral activity of bioactive compounds from mushrooms, including polyphenols, against various viruses.
results_summary: Polyphenols, along with other mushroom-derived compounds, demonstrated antiviral effects against DNA and RNA viruses, targeting virus entry, replication, and immune modulation. Some compounds showed effects comparable to antiviral drugs for HIV, influenza A, and hepatitis C.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo studies mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of polyphenols in managing adipose tissue inflammation and dysfunction, and their role in preventing obesity-related metabolic diseases.
results_summary: The study suggests polyphenols may help mitigate adipose tissue inflammation and dysfunction, potentially improving insulin resistance and metabolic health, though further research is needed to confirm these effects.
population_specificity: Individuals with obesity and related metabolic disorders (e.g., cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of grape-based polyphenol supplementation on oxidative stress markers in athletes.
results_summary: The study suggests that grape polyphenols may help mitigate exercise-induced oxidative stress, with potential antioxidant benefits for athletes across various sports. However, specific efficacy data and statistical significance are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Athletes from different sport disciplines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of tannins co-supplementation (ARBOX) on disease duration, severity, clinical symptoms, microbiota composition, and inflammatory mediators in SARS-CoV-2 patients.
results_summary: The study assessed outcomes such as time to hospital discharge, 28-day mortality, invasive ventilation rates, inflammation parameters, microbiota composition, and PCR negativization, but specific results for polyphenols' effects are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Adults (≥18 years) with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection, excluding pregnant/lactating patients, ICU cases, or those with polyphenol hypersensitivity.
effective_dosage: 2 capsules of ARBOX (390 mg each) per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy and safety of a whole tomato-based food supplement (WTFS) in reducing lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) in patients with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).
results_summary: The WTFS significantly reduced LUTS (P < 0.0002) and improved quality of life (P < 0.0001), with no reported side effects. A trend toward reduced PSA levels was observed, particularly in patients with baseline levels above 10 ng/mL.
population_specificity: 40 elderly men with histologically confirmed BPH.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if grape polyphenols could modulate glucose and lipid levels after two successive meals in obese individuals, known as the "second-meal effect."
results_summary: Grape powder supplementation did not significantly alter postprandial glucose, triglycerides, or plasma antioxidant capacity compared to placebo, suggesting insufficient polyphenol dosage to induce the desired effects.
population_specificity: Obese subjects (BMI ≥ 30 and < 40 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of resveratrol supplementation on renal function and blood pressure in patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) on hypoglycemic medication.
results_summary: Pooled estimates indicated that resveratrol supplementation modestly lowered fasting glucose levels in T2D patients, though the effect was not statistically significant. The impact on renal function and blood pressure remains inconclusive due to limited data.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) on hypoglycemic medication, primarily metformin or metformin combined with other drugs like insulin and glibenclamide.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of isoflavonoids as supplementary agents for managing type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) by examining their biological effects on metabolic disorders and long-term complications.
results_summary: Isoflavonoids were found to modulate carbohydrate metabolism, regulate hyperglycemia, reduce insulin resistance, and attenuate oxidative stress and inflammation, potentially preventing long-term diabetes complications such as cardiovascular disease and neuropathy.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients (type 2 diabetes mellitus).

study_goal: The abstract does not specify a research goal regarding polyphenols.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results regarding polyphenols' effects.
population_specificity: Not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of plant polyphenols as additives to sunscreens or stand-alone products to modulate the immunosuppressive effects of UV radiation on the skin.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that polyphenols, along with other antioxidants and photolyases, show promise in modulating UVR-induced immunosuppression, potentially offering protective benefits against skin cancer. However, specific efficacy data or clinical outcomes for polyphenols alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on UVR-exposed individuals)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a polyphenol-rich food supplement (NEWSUP) could improve working memory, cerebral blood flow, and nutritional status in children at risk of undernutrition.
results_summary: NEWSUP significantly improved working memory and hemoglobin concentration in children under 4, reduced BMI z-score gain, and increased lean tissue accretion compared to a control meal.
population_specificity: Children aged 15 months to 7 years (primary focus on those under 4) in Guinea-Bissau at risk of undernutrition.
effective_dosage: ≈1300 kJ per serving, five mornings each week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of red raspberry (poly)phenols on (poly)phenolic metabolism in adults with prediabetes and insulin resistance, and whether adding fructo-oligosaccharides (FOS) would enhance microbial metabolite production.
results_summary: After 4-week supplementation, several (poly)phenolic metabolite groups significantly increased, indicating enhanced metabolism. The study quantified 123 metabolites, suggesting a measurable impact of RRB and FOS on (poly)phenolic metabolism.
population_specificity: Adults with prediabetes and insulin resistance (n=25) and a healthy reference group (n=10).
effective_dosage: 1 cup red raspberries (fresh weight equivalence) per day, with or without 8 g FOS per day.
study_duration: 4 weeks per intervention, with a 4-week washout between treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of quercetin, a polyphenol, as a supplement for the prevention, treatment, and management of esophageal cancer due to its natural origin and low cost.
results_summary: The study found that quercetin exhibits cancer-related benefits through cell proliferation inhibition, proapoptotic effects, and antioxidant properties, but most findings are based on in vitro and in vivo studies, necessitating further human-based research.
population_specificity: Not specified (primarily in vitro and in vivo studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify the potential antiobesogenic effect of juçara (rich in polyphenols) supplementation in humans with obesity.
results_summary: Juçara supplementation significantly reduced body fat, increased HDL cholesterol, and doubled serum adiponectin levels, suggesting improvements in metabolic health. HDL cholesterol and neck circumference were predictors of enhanced adiponectin levels.
population_specificity: 35 adults with obesity of both sexes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pomegranate extract supplementation improves glycocalyx properties and microcirculation during high-intensity sprint interval cycling exercise.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in microcirculation or glycocalyx parameters after two weeks of pomegranate extract supplementation during high-intensity exercise.
population_specificity: 18 healthy, recreationally active male volunteers aged 22-28 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how polyphenols influence sports performance by interacting with the gut microbiota, epigenome, and genome, and how supplementation could modulate muscle inflammation and improve recovery.
results_summary: Polyphenols enhance physical performance through epigenetic mechanisms, interacting with the gut microbiota to produce bioactive molecules that affect mitochondrial biogenesis, antioxidant systems, glucose and lipid homeostasis, and DNA repair. Their effects are influenced by individual microbiome, epigenomic, and genomic characteristics.
population_specificity: Athletes (specific sport or demographic not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of oral resveratrol supplementation combined with diet and physical training changes on anthropometric and biochemical parameters in individuals with Metabolic Syndrome.
results_summary: Resveratrol supplementation improved total cholesterol, HDL-c, VLDL-c, urea, creatinine, and albumin serum levels, suggesting it may enhance the benefits of dietary and physical activity programs in Metabolic Syndrome treatment.
population_specificity: 25 individuals aged 30-60 years with BMI ≥ 30 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of nutraceutical supplementation, including polyphenols, in counteracting early-stage neurodegenerative processes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that antioxidant compounds, such as polyphenols, may help prevent or counteract neuronal cell death by addressing altered oxidative metabolism, loss of cellular cross-talk, and neuroinflammation in early neurodegenerative stages. However, specific efficacy data on polyphenols are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and Huntington's).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a standardized extract from French oak wood (containing polyphenols) on symptoms affecting quality of life during recovery from hysterectomy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results regarding the effects of the polyphenol extract.
population_specificity: Patients recovering from hysterectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and summarize existing literature on resveratrol's toxicity, side effects, and potential health benefits, while identifying gaps in knowledge regarding its safety and efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that resveratrol exhibits multiple pharmacological benefits, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and cardioprotective effects, but human clinical trials show inconsistent results. Toxicity and adverse effects were reported, highlighting the need for further research on long-term safety and optimal dosage.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review encompassing in vitro, in vivo, and human studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of polyphenols in preventing skeletal muscle atrophy by examining their effects on mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress.
results_summary: Polyphenols showed beneficial effects in preserving muscle mass and function across various skeletal muscle disorders, primarily by reversing mitochondrial dysfunction, though more comprehensive research is needed to clarify their mechanisms.
population_specificity: Various conditions leading to skeletal muscle atrophy (e.g., disuse, denervation, fasting, aging, disease).

study_goal: To determine whether oral administration of polyphenols from red grape seeds reduces peripheral biomarkers in patients with allergic contact dermatitis to nickel.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplementation decreased proinflammatory cytokines (interferon-γ, IL-4, IL-17, pentraxin 3, and NO) and increased anti-inflammatory IL-10 levels in treated patients, while placebo showed no changes.
population_specificity: 25 patients with allergic contact dermatitis to nickel (18 completed the study).

study_goal: To assess the efficacy and safety of resveratrol formulations for adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: The study found no significant effects of resveratrol on HbA1c, fasting blood glucose, or insulin resistance compared to placebo. No adverse events were reported, but the evidence was of very low certainty due to small sample sizes and short follow-up periods.
population_specificity: Adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential anti-aging effects of probiotics and their synbiotic combination with plant polyphenols, focusing on mitigating cellular senescence.
results_summary: The review highlights that probiotics may help reduce age-associated oxi-inflammatory stress, immunosenescence, and gut dysbiosis, potentially promoting health and longevity. It suggests that studying probiotics or their synbiotic amalgamation with polyphenols in the context of cellular senescence could lead to anti-senescence strategies.
population_specificity: General aging population (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanistic pathways behind CVD and T2DM development and assess the therapeutic potential of polyphenols derived from rice bran against these chronic diseases.
results_summary: The study suggests that polyphenols from rice bran have therapeutic potential against cellular oxidative stress, which may improve outcomes in CVD and T2DM. Emerging evidence indicates these bioactive compounds could mitigate oxidative stress-related damage.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on CVD and T2DM patients).

study_goal: To investigate the effects of a single dose of purple grape juice (rich in polyphenols) on physical performance, oxidative stress, inflammation, and muscle damage in recreational runners.
results_summary: A single dose of purple grape juice significantly increased run time to exhaustion and total antioxidant capacity (TAC) post-exercise, with no significant changes in markers of oxidative stress, inflammation, or muscle damage compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Fourteen recreational male runners (39 ± 9 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of Pycnogenol, a natural polyphenolic extract, on erectile function and lipid profile in patients with erectile dysfunction, particularly comparing diabetic and non-diabetic groups.
results_summary: Pycnogenol improved erectile function by 45% in diabetic patients and 22% in non-diabetic patients, lowered total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, and glucose levels in diabetic patients, and had no effect on glucose in non-diabetic patients. Placebo showed no effect in either group.
population_specificity: 53 patients with erectile dysfunction (32 with diabetes, 21 without diabetes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of grape product supplementation on lipid profiles in adults.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that grape products significantly reduced total cholesterol, LDL, and triglyceride levels but had no significant effect on HDL levels. The effects on HDL and LDL were dose-dependent based on polyphenol content.
population_specificity: Adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acute consumption of polyphenol-rich aronia juice before a simulated half-marathon could reduce platelet activation and aggregation in recreational runners.
results_summary: The study found that aronia juice significantly decreased platelet activation markers (P-selectin and GPIIb-IIIa) compared to placebo, suggesting cardioprotective effects during intense exercise.
population_specificity: 10 healthy male recreational runners (age 30.8 ± 2.3 years).
effective_dosage: 200 mL of aronia juice consumed once before the run.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether tart cherry juice (a source of polyphenols) could enhance recovery in professional soccer players after a match.
results_summary: Tart cherry juice did not significantly improve muscle function, subjective well-being, or reduce muscle soreness compared to the control drink, suggesting no hastened recovery in professional players.
population_specificity: 10 male professional soccer players from the reserve team of an English Premier League Club.
effective_dosage: 2 × 30-mL servings before and after the match, and 12 and 36 hours post-match.
study_duration: Measurements taken up to 60 hours post-match.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether New Zealand blackcurrant (NZBC) extract, rich in polyphenols, could enhance sport climbing performance and recovery by improving blood flow and metabolic by-product removal.
results_summary: NZBC extract showed no effect on pull-ups but improved climbing endurance (TCT +23%) compared to placebo (-11%), despite signs of progressive fatigue across three climbing bouts. Physiological recovery markers indicated insufficient recovery time, but NZBC still facilitated performance maintenance and improvement.
population_specificity: Male sport climbers (n=18, age 24±6 years, French grade 6a-8b).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Montmorency cherry (MC) supplementation, rich in polyphenols, affects glycaemic control, insulin sensitivity, and gut microbiome composition.
results_summary: MC supplementation did not clearly improve glucose handling or gut microbiome diversity, though it decreased the Matsuda index (indicating increased serum insulin). Placebo, but not MC, improved glucose clearance (OGIS estimate). No changes were observed in inflammatory markers (IL-6, C-reactive protein).
population_specificity: Adults aged 40-60 years.
effective_dosage: Daily MC supplementation (exact dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of noncarbohydrate nutrients, including polyphenols, in shaping gut microbiota composition and propose new approaches for dietary manipulation studies.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on polyphenols but highlights the need for broader research on noncarbohydrate nutrients and their impact on gut microbiota.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on mammalian gut microbiota).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether resveratrol, a polyphenol, could improve gut redox homeostasis and mitigate oxidative stress in the context of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: The study suggests that resveratrol acts as a scavenger of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and enhances the growth of beneficial gut bacteria, potentially aiding in the management of IBD-related dysbiosis and oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not mention human or animal subjects).

study_goal: To examine the effects of daily dietary raspberries (rich in polyphenols) on postprandial and fasting glucose, lipids, and inflammation biomarkers in obese adults with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Raspberry supplementation significantly lowered postprandial glucose and inflammation markers (IL-6, hsTNF-α) and showed a trend in reducing triglycerides and systolic blood pressure, but had no effect on fasting glucose, lipids, C-reactive protein, or arterial elasticity.
population_specificity: Obese adults with type 2 diabetes.
effective_dosage: Not specified (acute postprandial phase and 4-week daily supplementation).
study_duration: Postprandial phase (acute), followed by 4-week supplementation periods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of pomegranate (POM) supplementation on exercise performance, recovery, and related physiological responses in healthy adults, and to identify conditions under which POM is most beneficial.
results_summary: POM supplementation showed potential antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects during and after exercise, improved cardiovascular responses, and enhanced endurance, strength performance, and recovery. Benefits were less likely with unilateral eccentric exercise, low-polyphenol POM (<1.69 g/l), or insufficient time between ingestion and assessment (≤1 h).
population_specificity: Healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Montmorency tart cherry juice (MTCJ) supplementation could enhance fat oxidation rates at rest and during FATMAX exercise, thereby improving cardio-metabolic health.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in fat oxidation or cardio-metabolic markers between MTCJ and placebo groups. Pre-exercise total antioxidant status (TAS) and HDL were significantly reduced with MTCJ supplementation, but no other effects were observed.
population_specificity: Eleven healthy participants.

study_goal: To examine the impact of polyphenol supplementation on monocyte subset recruitment, mobilization, and activation following resistance exercise.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplementation altered monocyte subset proportions and reduced CD11b expression on intermediate and nonclassical monocytes at rest, suggesting potential modulation of immune responses post-exercise. Resistance exercise itself influenced monocyte mobilization, with polyphenols showing selective effects on intermediate monocytes at 24H and 48H.
population_specificity: 38 recreationally active males (22.1 ± 3.1 years; 173.9 ± 7.9 cm; 77.8 ± 14.5 kg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of consuming two SunGold kiwifruit daily on vitamin C status, clinical measures, and faecal microbiota composition in people with prediabetes.
results_summary: The study found a significant increase in plasma vitamin C levels (14 µmol/L) after 12 weeks of kiwifruit consumption, but human data on microbiota changes were lacking.
population_specificity: People with prediabetes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the cardioprotective effects of cocoa polyphenols (CPs) and omega-3 fatty acids and explore their combined potential in preventing cardiovascular disease (CVD).
results_summary: The study found that CPs and omega-3 fatty acids individually promote cardiovascular health, and their combination may enhance preventive effects and reduce CVD risk factors associated with aging.
population_specificity: Not specified (general cardiovascular health focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether montmorency cherry concentrate (MCC) enhances anabolic sensitivity to protein and exercise in older men.
results_summary: MCC did not significantly increase myofibrillar protein synthesis compared to placebo, despite reducing inflammatory protein expression post-exercise. The study concluded that short-term MCC ingestion does not enhance the acute anabolic response to protein and exercise in older men.
population_specificity: Healthy, relatively active older men (n=16).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether diets enriched with polyphenols could prevent or reduce toxicant-induced inflammation and lower disease risks linked to environmental pollutant exposure.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenols, as part of bioactive food components, can help decrease toxicant-induced inflammation and reduce vulnerability to non-communicable diseases associated with environmental toxins. Diets high in antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, including polyphenols, were suggested as a meaningful preventive measure.
population_specificity: General human populations, with implied focus on Southeast Asian regions due to high environmental contamination.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of polyphenols, as prebiotics, in restoring gut dysbiosis and counteracting the onset of Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenols could restore gut dysbiosis, suggesting a prebiotic role that may be effective in preventing or slowing Alzheimer's disease progression, independent of their antioxidant properties.
population_specificity: Cognitively impaired elderly patients with brain amyloidosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the central immunomodulatory effects of two Sceletium tortuosum extracts (one high in mesembrine and the other high in delta7-mesembrenone and polyphenols) in the context of obesity and diabetes-related inflammation.
results_summary: The high-mesembrine extract showed cytoprotective and anti-inflammatory effects, while the high delta7-mesembrenone extract, rich in polyphenols, exhibited potent antioxidant effects but carried a higher risk of adverse effects with overdose. Both extracts may serve as preventative or complementary treatments for obesity and diabetes.
population_specificity: Human astrocytes (in vitro study).
study_duration: 30-minute pre-treatment followed by 23.5-hour exposure to inflammatory stimulus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of berry-derived polyphenols to mitigate cognitive and neural impairments caused by high-fat diets in animal models.
results_summary: Berries rich in polyphenols showed promise in reducing oxidative stress and inflammation in the brain, potentially counteracting high-fat diet-induced cognitive decline, though challenges like variability in diet composition and animal model limitations were noted.
population_specificity: Animal models (predominantly male)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the association between nutrient intake (including polyphenols) and the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD).
results_summary: Observational studies found an inverse relationship between vitamins, n-3 fatty acids, and AD, while intervention studies supported the benefits of combined vitamins and n-3 fatty acids in early AD stages. High saturated fat intake and brain metal accumulation were positively associated with AD incidence.
population_specificity: Individuals at risk of or diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and evaluate the effect of cinnamon (a polyphenol-rich botanical) supplementation on blood lipid concentrations.
results_summary: Cinnamon supplementation significantly reduced blood triglycerides and total cholesterol but had no significant effect on LDL-C and HDL-C. Sensitivity analysis showed a significant elevation in HDL-C after omitting one study.
population_specificity: 750 participants across 13 randomized controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of polyphenol supplementation on plasma levels of prostaglandin E in healthy humans.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results, only stating that the anti-inflammatory property of polyphenols and their effect on prostaglandin metabolism is not established in healthy humans.
population_specificity: Healthy humans

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a polyphenol-rich diet could inhibit stress-induced immunomodulation of dendritic cells and improve immune recovery after strenuous exercise.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplementation did not significantly affect dendritic cell mobilization but supported regeneration of viral antigen-presenting TLR7 expression post-marathon, though it did not attenuate the detrimental effects of stress on dendritic cell populations.
population_specificity: 100 male endurance athletes around a marathon run.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential benefits of polyphenol supplementation on mental and physical well-being in overweight and obese individuals.
results_summary: The study suggests polyphenols may have positive effects on mental and physical health, though specific outcomes are not detailed in the abstract. The trial was conducted over 16 weeks with a daily supplement.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of healthful dietary patterns and plant polyphenols in modulating Aquaporins (AQPs) to understand their potential benefits in preventing or treating degenerative and chronic diseases.
results_summary: The study highlights that polyphenols and healthful dietary patterns may modulate AQPs, suggesting a potential mechanism for their beneficial effects in clinical disorders. However, the abstract does not provide specific outcomes or statistical results.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human body context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits of polyphenols, alongside carbohydrates, in mitigating physiological stress, inflammation, and immune perturbations in athletes.
results_summary: The study found that polyphenols, particularly when ingested through fruits, enhance oxidative and anti-viral capacity, increase plasma levels of gut-derived phenolics, and support performance. Metabolomics data indicated their role in modulating lipid mobilization and oxidation during exercise.
population_specificity: Athletes experiencing physiological stress, inflammation, and immune perturbations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether polyphenol supplementation could reduce physiological and cardiac stress induced by marathon running.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in CGA or NT-proBNP levels between athletes receiving polyphenol-enriched beverages versus placebo, indicating polyphenol supplementation did not attenuate marathon-induced stress in fast or slow runners.
population_specificity: 277 marathon runners, specifically analyzing the fastest 18 and slowest 22 runners.
effective_dosage: Approximately 400 mg of gallic acid equivalents per day (1-1.5 L/day of polyphenol-enriched beverage).
study_duration: Intervention lasted until marathon completion (exact duration not specified, but blood samples were taken 3 weeks and 1 day before, and up to 72 h after the marathon).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hydroxytyrosol (HT), a polyphenol, modulates miRNA expression in vivo and whether this modulation could explain its health benefits.
results_summary: HT modulated the expression of several miRNAs in mice and humans, suggesting a potential mechanism for its healthful activities. However, HT administration also increased triglyceride levels, warranting further investigation.
population_specificity: Mice and healthy human volunteers (in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial).
effective_dosage: Nutritionally relevant amounts (specific dosage not provided).
study_duration: 8 weeks in mice; duration in humans not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of pomegranate juice (a source of polyphenols) on plasma C-reactive protein (CRP) concentrations.
results_summary: The meta-analysis of 5 randomized controlled trials found no significant CRP-lowering effect of pomegranate juice supplementation, and this effect was independent of the duration of supplementation.
population_specificity: 427 participants (216 in PJ groups, 211 in control group) across the selected studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical applications of polyphenolic fractions from C. bergamia juice, particularly their effects on hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: Supplementation with polyphenols from bergamot juice reduced plasma lipids and improved lipoprotein profile in moderate hyperlipidemia, though the overall quality of studies was low.
population_specificity: Individuals with moderate hyperlipidemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the longer-term effects of combined epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) and resveratrol (RES) supplementation on metabolic profile, mitochondrial capacity, fat oxidation, lipolysis, and tissue-specific insulin sensitivity in overweight and obese individuals.
results_summary: EGCG+RES supplementation increased mitochondrial capacity and stimulated fat oxidation compared to placebo but did not improve tissue-specific insulin sensitivity. It also attenuated postprandial triacylglycerol increases and reduced visceral adipose tissue mass, though whole-body fat mass remained unchanged.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese subjects (18 men; aged 38 ± 2 years; BMI: 29.7 ± 0.5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of a single dose of proanthocyanidin on plasma leptin, adiponectin, and LDL(-) concentrations during and after intense, long-duration exercise.
results_summary: Proanthocyanidin supplementation reduced LDL(-) concentration and increased plasma adiponectin after 24 hours of rest, while exercise alone influenced leptin levels. The supplement and exercise interaction also significantly affected adiponectin and LDL(-).
population_specificity: 54 healthy male army cadets (22 ± 2 years)
study_duration: 48 hours of exercise followed by 24 hours of rest

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether polyphenol-rich aronia-citrus juice (ACJ) combined with physical exercise could influence oxidative stress biomarkers and DNA repair mechanisms in elite triathletes.
results_summary: The study found that ACJ intake and physical exercise reduced oxidative stress biomarkers (8-hydroxyguanine and 8-iso-PGF2α) and maintained guanosine-3',5'-cyclic monophosphate levels, while increasing 8-nitroguanosine, suggesting potential DNA repair benefits.
population_specificity: Sixteen elite triathletes on a controlled diet.
effective_dosage: Composition of 95% citrus juice with 5% Aronia melanocarpa juice (exact volume/frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of polyphenols as a therapeutic agent for preventing hepatic steatosis and its progression in NAFLD.
results_summary: The abstract suggests polyphenols are among the therapeutic agents analyzed for their effects on NAFLD, but specific results regarding their efficacy are not detailed. The review compiles evidence from human, animal, and cell models, indicating potential benefits.
population_specificity: Human, animal, and cell models related to NAFLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective and therapeutic potential of dietary polyphenols in managing peptic ulcer disease through various biological mechanisms.
results_summary: The study found that dietary polyphenols improve cytoprotection, reduce inflammation, enhance antioxidant activity, and block Helicobacter pylori colonization, demonstrating significant potential in treating peptic ulcers.
population_specificity: General peptic ulcer disease patients (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a Citrus-based polyphenol extract (Sinetrol® XPur) could improve body composition, metabolic parameters, and skeletal muscle metabolism in overweight men.
results_summary: After 12 weeks, the supplement led to slimming of the silhouette, significant improvement in metabolic parameters, and a reduction in skeletal muscle catabolism. The study suggests the supplement effectively addresses overweight and related muscle mass metabolism issues.
population_specificity: Overweight men

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the ergogenic effect of purple grape juice (rich in polyphenols) on recreational runners' performance, focusing on endurance, antioxidant activity, and inflammatory markers.
results_summary: Purple grape juice significantly increased running time-to-exhaustion (15.3%) and total antioxidant capacity (38.7%) while reducing some inflammatory markers, but did not improve anaerobic threshold or aerobic capacity. No significant changes were observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Recreational runners of both sexes (age 39.8 ± 8.5 years, peak oxygen consumption 43.2 ± 8.5 mL/(kg·min)).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of polyphenol supplementation on gut microbiota composition and whether changes in microbiota influenced metabolic responses, particularly fat oxidation.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplementation (EGCG+RES) altered gut microbiota composition in men but not women, reducing Bacteroidetes and tending to decrease Faecalibacterium prausnitzii. Baseline Bacteroidetes levels predicted increased fat oxidation in men after supplementation.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese men and women (18 males, 19 females, mean age 37.8 years, BMI 29.6 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of polyphenol supplementation on glycohemoglobin (HbA1c) levels in non-diabetic, pre-diabetic, and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) subjects.
results_summary: Polyphenol supplementation significantly reduced HbA1c levels in T2DM subjects but had no significant effect in non-diabetic or pre-diabetic subjects. The reduction was statistically significant and clinically relevant for T2DM patients.
population_specificity: Non-diabetic, pre-diabetic, and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) subjects (n = 1954).

study_goal: To evaluate the effects of grape powder supplementation (as a source of polyphenols) on inflammatory and antioxidant biomarkers in non-diabetic hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Grape powder supplementation increased glutathione peroxidase (GSH-Px) activity and prevented the rise in C-reactive protein (CRP) levels observed in the placebo group, suggesting antioxidant and anti-inflammatory benefits.
population_specificity: Non-diabetic hemodialysis patients (n=32, 18 men, mean age ~53 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of polyphenols as antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agents, using exercise as a model of study.
results_summary: The study summarizes evidence suggesting polyphenols may attenuate exercise-induced oxidative stress and inflammation, though it does not provide specific quantitative results. The abstract indicates polyphenols show potential as beneficial agents in mitigating oxidative damage.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on exercise-induced oxidative stress)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidiabetic and antiobesity effects of resveratrol and other polyphenols, comparing human and animal model outcomes, and exploring potential synergies of polyphenol combinations.
results_summary: Human studies showed mixed results for resveratrol's metabolic benefits, with inconsistent clinical relevance despite varying doses, while animal models consistently demonstrated improved insulin sensitivity, glucose disposal, and reduced fat deposition. The study suggests re-examining resveratrol targets and exploring novel polyphenols or combinations for diabesity treatment.
population_specificity: Human patients with obesity and diabetes, as well as animal models of diabesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary polyphenols on brain plasticity markers, cognition, mood, and their potential benefits in aging and Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that dietary polyphenols, along with other dietary interventions, enhanced markers of brain plasticity such as neurotrophic factors, synaptic function, and adult neurogenesis, and showed potential benefits for cognition, mood, and anxiety in both animal and human studies.
population_specificity: Animal studies and human epidemiological/intervention studies (specific populations not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of chokeberry polyphenol supplementation on ACE activity in patients with metabolic syndrome and compare its efficacy to ACE inhibitors.
results_summary: Chokeberry extract showed a modest reduction in ACE activity (25% after one month, 30% after two months) and exhibited weak ACE inhibition in vitro (IC50 = 155.4 μg/mL). The hypotensive effects may result from both ACE inhibition and other pleiotropic actions like antioxidative effects.
population_specificity: Patients with metabolic syndrome (n = 70, divided into three groups: MS patients receiving chokeberry extract, healthy controls, and MS patients on ACE inhibitors).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of polyphenol supplementation on exercise performance and biomarkers of oxidative stress and muscle damage, and to critically assess the existing exercise studies and biomarkers used.
results_summary: The review found insufficient evidence to recommend polyphenol supplementation for athletes, noting mixed results and a lack of comprehensive biomarker assessment. Polyphenols showed multiple biological effects, but future studies need better design to determine physiological interactions with exercise.
population_specificity: Sedentary, healthy individuals, or active, recreationally trained or well-trained athletes.
effective_dosage: Not specified (varied by study, including extracts, juices, infusions, or increased polyphenol-rich foods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oligomeric procyanidins (OPCs) from dietary supplements could enhance type I interferon (IFN) signaling in vitro and in vivo, compared to monomeric polyphenols.
results_summary: OPCs significantly increased pSTAT1 and enhanced type I IFN responses in vitro, in mice, and in human subjects, while monomeric polyphenols (e.g., RES) showed minimal effects. The findings suggest a unique, non-antioxidant mechanism of OPCs that may augment innate protection and contribute to anti-inflammatory outcomes.
population_specificity: Mice and human subjects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the acute effects of grape polyphenols on endothelial function, as measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD), in adults.
results_summary: The study found that grape polyphenols significantly increased FMD levels within 120 minutes of intake, with peak effects at 30 minutes in healthy subjects and 60 minutes in those with high cardiovascular risk factors. The effect was more pronounced in individuals with cardiovascular risk factors.
population_specificity: Healthy adults and adults with high cardiovascular risk factors (e.g., smoking history or coronary heart disease).
study_duration: Acute effects measured within 2 hours post-ingestion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antioxidative effects of hardaliye, a grape-based beverage rich in polyphenols, on healthy adults by measuring biomarkers of oxidative stress and antioxidant capacity.
results_summary: Significant reductions in dien conjugate (DC), malondialdehyde (MDA), and homocysteine levels were observed in both high and low hardaliye groups, with a dose-dependent effect seen only for homocysteine. Total antioxidant capacity (TAC) and vitamin C levels showed slight but non-significant increases.
population_specificity: 89 healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of resveratrol supplementation on plasma metabolic response and oxidative stress indicators in Brazilian military firefighters before and after a physical fitness test.
results_summary: Resveratrol supplementation showed no hepatic consequences, increased plasma glucose and triglycerides post-exercise, and reduced IL-6 and TNF-α levels, indicating an anti-inflammatory effect. However, it did not significantly impact antioxidant defense systems or most oxidative stress biomarkers.
population_specificity: Brazilian military firefighters

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate interindividual differences in trans-resveratrol metabolism by human gut microbiota and identify bacterial strains involved in this process.
results_summary: The study identified two previously unknown bacterial metabolites of trans-resveratrol (3,4'-dihydroxy-trans-stilbene and lunularin) and confirmed pronounced interindividual variability in metabolism. Two bacterial strains (Slackia equolifaciens and Adlercreutzia equolifaciens) were identified as dihydroresveratrol producers.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers (7 in vitro, 12 in vivo)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the potential role of polyphenols in influencing neuroregulatory factors, neural signaling pathways, and peripheral feedback mechanisms related to food intake and obesity.
results_summary: The study found that dietary supplementation with polyphenolic compounds is associated with reduced diet-induced obesity and metabolic syndrome in animal and human studies, with potential effects on insulin sensitivity and anti-inflammatory pathways. The abstract suggests polyphenols may modulate key peripheral signals like leptin, insulin, and ghrelin, but mechanistic details are not fully elucidated.
population_specificity: Animal and human studies (not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bilberry polyphenols could reduce low-grade inflammation and influence gene expression in individuals with metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: Bilberry consumption showed a tendency to decrease inflammatory markers (high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, IL-6, IL-12, LPS) and significantly improved an inflammation score. Transcriptomics and QPCR analyses indicated altered gene expression related to immune function.
population_specificity: Individuals with metabolic syndrome (n = 27 total, bilberry group n = 15, control group n = 12).
effective_dosage: Equivalent to 400 g fresh bilberries daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of polyphenols as a therapeutic approach to counter proinflammatory responses in Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study suggests that polyphenols may counteract proinflammatory responses in Alzheimer's disease, potentially offering a new therapeutic approach, though clinical trials of similar anti-inflammatory treatments (NSAIDs) have not been successful.
population_specificity: Alzheimer's disease patients (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Aronia melanocarpa polyphenol supplementation on cholesterol concentration, lipid peroxidation, membrane fluidity, thiol groups, and ATPase activity in erythrocytes of hypercholesterolemic patients.
results_summary: The study found that 2-month supplementation with Aronia extract reduced cholesterol concentration by 22%, decreased lipid peroxidation by 40%, and increased membrane fluidity, but did not significantly affect thiol groups or ATPase activity.
population_specificity: 25 hypercholesterolemic patients without pharmacological treatment and 20 healthy controls.
effective_dosage: 100 mg Aronox, three times per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the anti-inflammatory properties of grape powder (GP) and grape extract (GE), their bioavailability, and their effects on glucose tolerance and inflammation in obese mice and human adipocytes.
results_summary: GP improved glucose tolerance and reduced inflammation markers by 20-50% in obese mice, while Q3G (a polyphenol in GE) reduced inflammatory gene expression by 30-40% in human adipocytes. Q3G and Q3GN were identified as bioavailable polyphenols in GE.
population_specificity: Obese C57BL/6J mice and human adipocytes.
effective_dosage: 3% GP or 0.02% GE in diet for mice; Q3G and Q3GN treatments for adipocytes.
study_duration: 18 weeks for mice; acute measurements for adipocytes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether polyphenol intake, alongside exercise training, could reduce white adipose tissue mass and improve adipokine expression in obese individuals.
results_summary: The study suggests that polyphenol intake, combined with exercise, may reduce white adipose tissue mass and positively influence adipokine expression, potentially aiding in the prevention and improvement of obesity-related diseases.
population_specificity: Obese individuals and those with lifestyle-related diseases such as type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a dietary supplement containing red yeast rice, sugar cane-derived policosanols, and artichoke leaf extracts on LDL-cholesterol levels in individuals with moderate hypercholesterolemia.
results_summary: The dietary supplement significantly reduced LDL-cholesterol by 21.4% and total cholesterol by 14.1% after 16 weeks, with similar results observed at earlier time points. Triglycerides also decreased by 12.2%, and a difference in the vitamin E/TC ratio was noted between groups at week 16.
population_specificity: 39 subjects aged 21-55 with moderate hypercholesterolemia, not on drug treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the challenges and potential solutions for improving the bioavailability and therapeutic efficacy of resveratrol (RSV), a polyphenol, through novel delivery systems.
results_summary: The study highlights RSV's low bioavailability due to physicochemical limitations and inefficient systemic delivery, despite its promising therapeutic activities. New delivery systems are proposed as alternatives to enhance RSV's protection and bioavailability compared to classical formulations.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of polyphenols as a natural alternative for preventing or treating inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) by modulating oxidative and inflammatory pathways.
results_summary: Polyphenols demonstrated effectiveness in modulating intestinal inflammation in animal models and cell lines, primarily by influencing cell signaling pathways like NF-kB. However, clinical evidence in humans remains limited, necessitating further studies.
population_specificity: Animal models of colitis (chemically induced or genetically modified) and intestinal cell lines treated with pro-inflammatory stimuli.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the bioactive potential, polyphenolic profile, and antioxidative properties of red raspberry leaf extract, focusing on its effects on human laryngeal carcinoma (HEp2) and colon adenocarcinoma (SW 480) cell lines.
results_summary: Raspberry leaf extract exhibited cytotoxic and antioxidative effects in HEp2 cells but induced reactive oxygen species formation in SW 480 cells. It increased total glutathione levels in HEp2 cells, suggesting cell-type-dependent biological activity.
population_specificity: Human laryngeal carcinoma (HEp2) and colon adenocarcinoma (SW 480) cell lines.
study_duration: Not specified (effects observed after 24 hours of recovery)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the neuroprotective properties of polyphenols, particularly resveratrol (RES), and the mechanisms by which it may protect against oxidative damage and cell death.
results_summary: The study found that RES administration protects neuronal cells from stress-induced death in vitro and ameliorates neuronal damage in rodents. While its antioxidant potential is noted, the exact mechanisms remain unclear, with possible involvement of estrogen receptors and sirtuins.
population_specificity: Rodents and neuronal cell cultures

study_goal: To determine the effect of an antioxidant beverage rich in polyphenols on plasmatic levels of total homocysteine (tHcy) in Alzheimer's patients.
results_summary: The antioxidant beverage attenuated the increase in tHcy levels in both control and Alzheimer's patients, with more pronounced effects in moderate-phase AD patients. Lower folate levels were observed in moderate-phase AD patients compared to initial-phase and control groups.
population_specificity: 100 subjects (52 controls, 24 initial-phase AD patients, 24 moderate-phase AD patients) with Mini-Mental State Examination scores between 14 and 26.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether acute resveratrol consumption enhances flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) and if there is a dose-response relationship for this effect.
results_summary: The study found a significant dose-dependent increase in both plasma resveratrol concentration and FMD, with the highest dose (270 mg) improving FMD from 4.1% to 7.7%. FMD was also linearly related to plasma resveratrol levels.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese men and post-menopausal women with untreated borderline hypertension (BMI 25-35 kg/m², systolic BP 130-160 mmHg or diastolic BP 85-100 mmHg).
effective_dosage: 30 mg, 90 mg, and 270 mg of resveratrol (resVida™), administered once at weekly intervals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ellagitannin supplementation from pomegranate extract (POMx) improved recovery of skeletal muscle strength after eccentric exercise.
results_summary: POMx significantly improved recovery of isometric strength at 48 and 72 hours post-exercise compared to placebo, though strength recovery remained incomplete by 96 hours. Serum markers of inflammation and muscle damage did not explain the mechanism of improvement.
population_specificity: Recreationally active males

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of bilberry juice, rich in polyphenols, on inflammation and antioxidant status in individuals with elevated cardiovascular disease risk factors.
results_summary: Bilberry juice significantly reduced plasma concentrations of inflammatory biomarkers (CRP, IL-6, IL-15, MIG) but unexpectedly increased TNF-alpha. Polyphenols like quercetin, epicatechin, and resveratrol inhibited NF-kappaB activation in vitro.
population_specificity: Subjects with elevated levels of at least one cardiovascular disease risk factor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of pomegranate extracts in modulating cancer-related signaling pathways and its role in preventing and treating various cancers.
results_summary: Pomegranate extracts demonstrated anti-proliferative, anti-tumorigenic, and anti-inflammatory properties by modifying cancer-related signaling pathways, suggesting potential as a preventive and therapeutic agent for cancers such as prostate, bladder, breast, skin, lung, and colon. The high polyphenol content in pomegranate was linked to these beneficial effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general potential for cancer prevention/treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biological activities of pomegranate peel extract (PPE) on oral mucosa, focusing on antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antibacterial effects for potential use in mouthwashes.
results_summary: PPE demonstrated significant antioxidant activity, increased Superoxide Dismutase 1 expression, and reduced inflammatory markers (TNF-α and MCP-1). It also showed strong antibacterial effectiveness against oral Streptococcus species.
population_specificity: Human Primary Gingival Epithelial Cells (HGECs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop nutritional bars enriched with pomegranate peel powder and evaluate their nutritional, phytochemical, and sensory properties.
results_summary: Bars with 15% pomegranate peel powder (T3) showed the highest overall acceptability, increased antioxidant potential, and enhanced phenolic and flavonoid content compared to control. Proximate and mineral analyses confirmed improved nutritional profiles with higher pomegranate peel concentrations.
