population_specificity: Not specified (general population implied).
effective_dosage: 5%, 10%, 15%, and 20% pomegranate peel powder in nutritional bars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify bioactive compounds in pomegranate flowers and evaluate their whitening and anti-aging effects.
results_summary: The study isolated five compounds, with compounds 3 and 5 showing significant tyrosinase inhibition (whitening effect). All compounds downregulated MMP1 gene expression, reduced matrix metalloproteinase 1, and increased type 1 collagen (anti-aging effects).
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or cell-based study implied).
effective_dosage: Maximum safe concentration (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine whether natural pomegranate juice, due to its antioxidant properties, could improve craving and blood redox status in patients with opioid use disorders (OUDs).
results_summary: Pomegranate juice consumption improved craving in all patients and enhanced their blood antioxidant potential. The evidence suggests it could be a beneficial auxiliary nutritional intervention for opioid-addicted patients.
population_specificity: Patients with opioid use disorders (OUDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the pharmacodynamics of pomegranate's bioactive compounds and synthesize current literature on its role in benign gynecological disorders.
results_summary: Pomegranate extract reduced testosterone levels, oxidative stress, and inflammation biomarkers in women with polycystic ovary syndrome, improved menopause-specific quality of life, and enhanced bone formation while reducing vaginal atrophy in a murine model.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovary syndrome, menopausal women, and a pre-clinical murine model following ovariectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of high-pressure homogenization (HPH) on the physicochemical properties, antimicrobial activity, bioaccessibility, and antioxidant capacity of freshly squeezed pomegranate juices (PJS) from different genotypes.
results_summary: HPH treatment increased total phenolic content and antioxidant capacity while decreasing anthocyanin and ascorbic acid content. The 150 MPa HPH treatment of Saricakaya-1 genotype showed the highest bioaccessibility of phenolics and recovered antioxidant capacity after in vitro digestion.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on pomegranate juice genotypes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether pomegranate juice (PJ) could protect against neurotoxicity and oxidative stress induced by carbon tetrachloride (CCl4) in rats.
results_summary: PJ significantly reduced oxidative stress markers (MDA and AChE activity) and apoptotic cell death in CCl4-exposed rats, though it did not significantly restore GSH levels or GST activity. The findings suggest PJ has neuroprotective effects against CCl4-induced damage.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects of P. granatum peel extract (PGPE) in sepsis-related acute lung injury (ALI).
results_summary: PGPE significantly reduced TBARS and TNF-α levels, improved total thiol levels, and decreased MMP-2 and MMP-9 immunopositivity, demonstrating lung-protective effects in sepsis-induced ALI.
population_specificity: Experimental animal models (cecal ligation and puncture-induced sepsis).
effective_dosage: 250 mg/kg and 500 mg/kg PGPE via oral gavage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a nanocomposite hydrogel containing pomegranate peel extract (PPE), hyaluronic acid (HA), and silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) in treating C. albicans-infected wounds and promoting wound healing.
results_summary: The study found that PPE-HA-AgNPs significantly reduced C. albicans burden, inflammatory markers, and biofilm-related genes while enhancing wound healing markers like VEGF, TGF-β1, and collagen production, leading to efficient wound closure.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats infected with C. albicans.
effective_dosage: Full, 50%, and 25% concentrations of PPE-HA-AgNPs (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how ultrasonic treatment time affects the structural characteristics and biological activities (antioxidant, α-amylase inhibitory, and prebiotic properties) of pomegranate peel pectin (PPP).
results_summary: Ultrasonic treatment reduced molecular weight, particle size, and degree of esterification of PPP while enhancing its antioxidant activity, α-amylase inhibition, and prebiotic effects, particularly promoting the growth of beneficial bacteria like Bifidobacterium longum and Lactobacillus casei.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Not specified (ultrasonic treatment times ranged from 5-30 minutes)
study_duration: Not specified (treatment times up to 30 minutes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of pomegranate peel extract in improving metabolic features, liver enzymes, lipid profile, and inflammation markers in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: Pomegranate peel extract significantly reduced triglycerides (TG), liver enzymes (ALT, AST), and inflammation (hs-CRP), while increasing HDL-C, but did not significantly affect LDL-C, TC, ALP, GGT, or fatty liver grade compared to the placebo group.
population_specificity: 46 patients with NAFLD (42 completed the trial).
effective_dosage: Two 500 mg capsules of pomegranate peel extract daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prebiotic potential of pectin from pomegranate peel and its enzymatic hydrolysates, and to produce a functional fermented beverage enriched with GABA.
results_summary: Pectin hydrolysates from pomegranate peel enhanced GABA production in fermented carrot juice, with GABA levels increasing with hydrolysate concentration. The hydrolysate also significantly affected the total phenolic content and antioxidant activity of the juice.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and food matrix study)
effective_dosage: 400 μL enzyme for 2 h hydrolysis (hydrolysate concentration varied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic effect of pomegranate peel extract (PPE) on diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D) and elucidate its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: PPE significantly improved IBS-D symptoms, reduced intestinal inflammation, and enhanced intestinal barrier function by inhibiting the MAPK and NF-κB signaling pathways. Molecular docking and Western blot analysis confirmed PPE's high affinity for key proteins in these pathways and its ability to down-regulate their expression.
population_specificity: Rat model mimicking IBS-D (induced by high-fat diet, restraint stress, and senna gavage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of PG2, a pomegranate peptide, on inducing apoptosis in acute leukemia cells and its potential synergistic effects with daunorubicin.
results_summary: PG2 significantly reduced the viability of NB4 and MOLT-4 leukemia cells and showed a synergistic effect when combined with daunorubicin. It decreased CDK2 expression while increasing microRNA-339-5p and caspase-3 expression, suggesting apoptosis induction via extracellular vesicles.
population_specificity: NB4 and MOLT-4 leukemia cell lines

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the bioactive properties of pomegranate and its potential applications in preventing and treating gingivitis, periodontitis, and other oral diseases.
results_summary: Pomegranate extracts were found effective in reducing plaque, inhibiting harmful oral microorganisms, and promoting overall oral health. Clinical studies suggest pomegranate-based products like mouthwashes and gels could serve as viable alternatives to conventional pharmaceuticals, though further research is needed for optimal formulations and long-term safety.
population_specificity: Individuals with or at risk of gingivitis, periodontitis, or other oral diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of pomegranate extract for women's reproductive health, including fertility, menstrual regulation, pregnancy support, PCOS treatment, and anticancer properties.
results_summary: Pomegranate extract showed antioxidant properties, potential hormonal regulation, and benefits for placental development and fetal growth. It also demonstrated promise in improving insulin sensitivity and reducing inflammation in PCOS, though further human trials are needed.
population_specificity: Women (focus on reproductive health, fertility, pregnancy, PCOS, and breast cancer)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of pomegranate supplements on insulin resistance and insulin sensitivity through a systematic review and meta-analysis of RCTs, while also evaluating differences in efficacy among various pomegranate extracts and disease sensitivities.
results_summary: Pomegranate extract showed no significant overall improvement in HOMA-IR or fasting insulin levels but demonstrated benefits in PCOS patients for HOMA-IR and in T2DM, PCOS, and NAFLD patients for fasting insulin. No significant effects were observed for QUICKI in other metabolic diseases.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals, overweight/obese individuals, NAFLD patients, T2DM patients, PCOS patients, metabolic syndrome patients, and hyperlipidemia patients.
effective_dosage: Not specified (varied by extract type, including juice, seed oil capsules, peel extract capsules, and peel-added bread).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of pomegranate extract supplementation on PMS symptoms and quality of life in women.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant reduction in PMS symptoms in the intervention group compared to the control group, as well as improved social quality of life scores in the intervention group.
population_specificity: Women with PMS in a city in western Turkey.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if pomegranate peel-derived hard carbon (PPHC) could serve as an effective, low-cost anode material for sodium-ion batteries.
results_summary: PPHC pyrolyzed at 1100 °C exhibited a reversible capacity of 330 mAh g⁻¹, maintained 174 mAh g⁻¹ at 1 C, and delivered 175 mAh g⁻¹ after 200 cycles at 0.5 C, demonstrating improved ion transport and capacitive-controlled energy storage.
population_specificity: Sodium-ion battery anode materials (in vitro/experimental study, no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (material synthesis process involved pyrolysis at 1100 °C).
study_duration: Not applicable (electrochemical testing involved cycling over 200 charge/discharge cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of pomegranate exocarp extract (PEE) on epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in H. pylori-induced pancreatic tissue and uncover its molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: PEE significantly reduced H. pylori concentration, improved pancreatic tissue health, and modulated key molecular markers (e.g., increased E-cadherin, decreased vimentin). The combined PEE and metronidazole treatment showed the highest efficacy.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats infected with H. pylori.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and discuss the evidence of pomegranate extract's benefits in slowing aging processes by targeting inflammaging mechanisms.
results_summary: Pomegranate's bioactive compounds demonstrated antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anticancer effects, potentially aiding in slowing aging-related inflammaging, though no human studies confirmed these effects. The review highlighted applications in neurodegenerative and skin diseases but noted limited evidence in other areas.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies, no specific population mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to improve the stability and functional properties of pomegranate peel polyphenols (PPPs) by developing microcapsules using β-cyclodextrin, whey protein isolate, and ultrasound treatment.
results_summary: Ultrasound-treated CD-WPI-PPPs showed significantly higher encapsulation efficiency (93.73%), reduced degradation rate (95.83% reduction), extended half-life (23-fold increase), and improved antioxidant activity and controlled release during digestion compared to unencapsulated PPPs.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the antidepressant- and anxiolytic-like effects of pomegranate extracts and their potential mechanisms of action in animal models.
results_summary: Pomegranate extracts showed antidepressant- and anxiolytic-like effects, possibly mediated by serotonin receptors, estrogen receptors, PPARγ, monoamine oxidase enzymes, antioxidant properties, and neuroplasticity. The study suggests pomegranate may modulate stress responses by targeting multiple pathways.
population_specificity: Animal models (not specified further)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the inhibitory effect of pomegranate flower polysaccharide (PFPS) on mastitis through in vitro and in vivo models, including its impact on inflammation, oxidative stress, and intestinal flora regulation.
results_summary: PFPS inhibited LPS-enhanced phagocytosis and cytokine release in vitro, reduced inflammation in mouse models (ear swelling, paw edema, mastitis), and regulated intestinal flora by reducing pathogenic bacteria and increasing probiotics.
population_specificity: Mice (in vivo models) and RAW 264.7 cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of pomegranate seed oil (PSO) in combination with xanthan gum and Spirulina platensis extract in preserving the quality and extending the shelf life of Mexican lime fruit.
results_summary: The study found that xanthan gum combined with pomegranate seed oil (0.05%) was less effective in maintaining fruit greenness compared to other treatments, but all coatings generally improved antioxidant capacity, phenolic content, and enzyme activity. The combination of xanthan gum and Spirulina platensis extract showed the highest efficacy in reducing weight loss and enhancing antioxidant properties.
population_specificity: Mexican lime fruits (Citrus aurantifolia cv.)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify pomegranate peel extract and its phytochemicals as potential inhibitors of 6PGD for breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: Pomegranate peel extract showed significant 6PGD inhibitory activity (IC50 = 0.090 μg/mL) and potent anti-breast cancer effects against MCF-7 cells (IC50 = 3.138 μg/mL). Three phytochemicals (Procyanidin, Delphinidin, Cyanidin) exhibited strong binding affinities with 6PGD.
population_specificity: In vitro (MCF-7 cells) and in vivo (mice) models.
effective_dosage: 2000mg/kg (toxicity profiling), IC50 values provided for inhibitory activity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two pomegranate juice extraction methods (manual and mechanical pressing with hyperbaric sanitization) on polyphenol content, antioxidant activity, and antihypertensive effects.
results_summary: Both extraction methods increased antioxidant and antihypertensive activity, with manual extraction showing higher phenol concentration and DPPH inhibition, while mechanical pressing with hyperbaric sanitization yielded higher moisture, soluble solids, protein, and carbohydrates. No pathogenic microorganisms were detected in either juice.
population_specificity: Hypertensive and normotensive patients (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of pomegranate polyphenols on oxidative stress, inflammation, and Tau phosphorylation in the context of atherosclerosis and Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: Pomegranate polyphenols significantly reduced inflammation, oxidative stress, and Tau phosphorylation while improving cell viability and exhibiting anti-apoptotic effects in human cell models.
population_specificity: Human cell models (THP-1 macrophages, HMC3 microglia, U373-MG astrocytes, H4 neurons).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Pomegranate Peel Extract Nanoparticles (PPENPs) on male fertility parameters in diabetic rats.
results_summary: PPENPs improved insulin levels, hormone levels (FSH, LH, testosterone), antioxidant markers, sperm quality, and testis tissue architecture while reducing glucose, oxidative stress markers, and sperm abnormalities in diabetic rats.
population_specificity: Male diabetic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective effects of fermented pomegranate (PG-F) against hydrogen peroxide-induced neurotoxicity in human neuroblastoma cells and elucidate the underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: PG-F significantly enhanced cell viability, reduced oxidative stress, restored mitochondrial function, and suppressed apoptotic pathways. The synergistic action of ellagic acid and gallic acid in PG-F demonstrated strong neuroprotective effects.
population_specificity: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the prevalence and management of pomegranate wilt disease caused by Meloidogyne incognita, focusing on nematode population dynamics and the efficacy of treatments like Fluopyram and Fluensulfone.
results_summary: The study found significant spatial and temporal variations in nematode infestations, with Fluopyram reducing larvae by 98.56% in field conditions and 99.00% in pot conditions. Weed species like Chenopodium album and Solanum nigrum were identified as potential reservoirs for M. incognita.
population_specificity: Pomegranate plants in the Kullu, Mandi, and Solan districts of Himachal Pradesh, India.
study_duration: Symptoms observed 45-60 days post-inoculation; treatment duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of crushed pomegranate peel in removing mercury and cadmium ions from contaminated water under varying experimental conditions.
results_summary: Pomegranate peel demonstrated high adsorption capacities for cadmium (89.59 mg/g) and mercury (42.125 mg/g) ions, with optimal performance at pH 4.8. The Langmuir model best described the adsorption behavior.
population_specificity: Contaminated water samples (no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (crushed pomegranate peel used as adsorbent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a green synthesis method for superparamagnetic nanoparticles (SPMNPs) using pomegranate peel extract as a stabilizing agent and optimize their properties for magnetic hyperthermia applications.
results_summary: The study found that reducing pomegranate peel extract volume increased nanoparticle magnetization, N2 gas prevented oxidation, and NaOH as a precipitating agent yielded higher magnetization than NH3. Nanoparticles synthesized at pH 10 exhibited superior magnetization compared to pH 8 and 12.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a mixture of pomegranate peel powder and autologous bone marrow could accelerate burn wound healing in diabetic rabbits.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of pomegranate peel powder and bone marrow (PPBM) significantly accelerated wound healing compared to other treatments, with increased fibroblast and collagen scores and elevated levels of biomarkers PDGF-AA and PAR-1.
population_specificity: Experimentally induced diabetic rabbits with deep second-degree burn wounds.
study_duration: Measurements taken on days 0, 4, 8, and 12 (intervention duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the phytochemical composition, physical characteristics, and therapeutic potential (antioxidant, anti-diabetic, and anti-lipase activities) of pomegranate seed oil and its self-nanoemulsifying system.
results_summary: The study found that pomegranate seed oil and its self-nanoemulsifying system exhibited potent antioxidant activity, moderate anti-diabetic effects (α-amylase inhibition), and strong anti-lipase activity, with the nanoemulsifying system showing enhanced efficacy compared to the oil alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or animal study implied by methodology).
effective_dosage: Not specified (concentrations like 354.81 ± 2.3 µg/ml for α-amylase inhibition mentioned, but no human dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antimicrobial effectiveness of Punica granatum extract (PGE) on oral multispecies biofilms compared to chlorhexidine (CHX).
results_summary: The 30% PGE demonstrated greater antibiofilm effectiveness than 2% CHX, killing 37-55.3% of bacteria in biofilms of varying ages. Combining 30% PGE with 2% CHX further enhanced the antibiofilm effect compared to CHX alone.
population_specificity: Oral multispecies biofilms from 2 donors grown on collagen-coated hydroxyapatite discs.
effective_dosage: 10%, 20%, and 30% PGE solutions, with 30% being the most effective.
study_duration: Biofilms were exposed to solutions for 3 minutes after 7 days or 3 weeks of growth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate knowledge on the medicinal properties of pomegranate seeds, summarizing their chemical composition, traditional uses, and pharmacological effects in treating various diseases.
results_summary: Pomegranate seeds contain bioactive compounds like punicic acid, which show potential in preventing and treating cancers, diabetes, obesity, and other ailments. The seeds also exhibit stomach tonicity, qi regulation, analgesia, and anti-inflammatory effects.
population_specificity: Traditional medicine users in Uyghur and Tibetan cultures, as well as broader applications in traditional Chinese medicine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pomegranate seed oil (PSO) could protect against α-Amanitin-induced liver damage in rats.
results_summary: PSO significantly reduced α-A-induced liver inflammation and caspase 3 activation, while also preventing protein degradation. However, it did not significantly affect serum liver function markers (ALT, AST, ALP).
population_specificity: Rats exposed to α-Amanitin or saline.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of pomegranate peel powder-based multigrain chapatti as a dietary intervention to improve blood glucose metabolism and prevent diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that the pomegranate peel powder-based multigrain chapatti, particularly treatment T3 (15% pomegranate juice), improved nutritional and antioxidant profiles, had high sensory acceptability, and demonstrated positive effects on blood glucose levels and HbA1C, suggesting potential benefits for diabetes prevention.
population_specificity: Individuals at risk for or with diabetes (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
effective_dosage: 15% pomegranate juice in treatment T3 (exact daily intake not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the inhibitory effects of pomegranate peel fractions on urease-producing bacterial species and jack bean urease activity.
results_summary: Pomegranate peel fractions showed significant inhibition of bacterial growth (P. mirabilis, S. epidermidis, K. pneumoniae) and urease activity, with anthocyanin fractions being the most active. The study also identified compounds interacting with urease active sites, explaining their inhibitory mechanism.
population_specificity: In vitro bacterial cultures (Klebsiella, Proteus, Streptococcus) and jack bean urease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer potential of triterpenes extracted from pomegranate peel (TPP) and their mechanism of action via the MAPK pathway.
results_summary: TPP inhibited cell proliferation, promoted apoptosis, reduced mitochondrial membrane potential, increased ROS levels, and altered expression of apoptotic proteins and MAPK pathway components, suggesting potential for adjuvant tumor therapy.
population_specificity: In vitro (cell-based study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the physicochemical properties, origin, pharmacokinetics, and potential mechanisms of punicalagin in preventing and treating mild cognitive impairment (MCI).
results_summary: Preclinical and clinical studies suggest punicalagin may effectively target MCI through antioxidative, anti-neuroinflammatory, neurogenesis-promoting, and neurotransmitter-modulating mechanisms, though more rigorous trials are needed.
population_specificity: Aging population at risk for or with mild cognitive impairment (MCI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of pomegranate peel extract (PPE) on inflammatory markers and MMP1 in women with knee osteoarthritis (OA).
results_summary: PPE supplementation significantly reduced serum inflammatory markers (hs-CRP, NF-ĸB, MCP-1) and MMP1 levels in women with knee OA compared to placebo, suggesting anti-inflammatory benefits.
population_specificity: Obese women aged 38-60 years with knee OA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review pomegranate's effects on metabolic syndrome (MetS) parameters using a mechanistic approach based on pre-clinical studies.
results_summary: Pomegranate contains bioactive compounds with anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, cardioprotective, antidiabetic, and antiobesity effects, which may counteract MetS-related risk factors. The juice extract was noted to regulate blood pressure by inhibiting angiotensin-converting enzyme activities.
population_specificity: Pre-clinical studies (specific human or animal populations not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how dietary modifications with pomegranate seed oil (PSO) affect mineral content in the spleen of rats under normal conditions and with mammary tumorigenesis.
results_summary: PSO supplementation significantly altered the content of several elements (Fe, Se, Co, Cr, Ni, etc.) in rat spleen, with the carcinogenic process having the greatest impact on mineral composition. The findings may help understand immune organ functioning during cancer and inform prevention strategies.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley female rats with induced mammary tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether pomegranate peel extract (PGPE) could mitigate testicular dysfunctions induced by furan in male rats.
results_summary: PGPE pre-treatment significantly improved oxidative stress, antioxidative protein activity, testicular parameters, hormone levels, and sperm quality in furan-exposed rats, demonstrating protective effects against furan-induced testicular injury.
population_specificity: Male rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms behind reduced fruit cracking in pomegranates under bagging conditions, focusing on the role of PgCML23 and related pathways.
results_summary: The study found that bagging conditions upregulated genes linked to calcium signaling and XTH activity, while PgCML23 overexpression in tomatoes reduced fruit cracking by altering cellulose, pectin, and enzyme activities.
population_specificity: Pomegranate fruit peel and transgenic tomatoes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of pomegranate peel extracts and juice powder in inhibiting the growth of enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli (EHEC) strains.
results_summary: Extracts from powdered pomegranate peels significantly reduced E. coli populations more than whole peel or juice powder extracts, with higher doses yielding greater reductions. The reduction correlated positively with ellagitannin content and titratable acidity.
population_specificity: Enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli (EHEC) strains in vitro.
effective_dosage: 9% or 23% of each extract in tryptic soy broth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of pomegranate peel-derived silver nanoparticles (PGNP) as an alternative therapy for sepsis by assessing its effects on immune response, oxidative stress, and inflammation.
results_summary: PGNP treatment improved spleen health, reduced oxidative stress markers, suppressed pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-1β, IL-6, TNF-α), and regulated apoptosis-related genes (Bax, Bcl-2, Casp3), demonstrating anti-inflammatory and immune-enhancing effects in a rat sepsis model.
population_specificity: Rats with induced sepsis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the ameliorative effects of pomegranate seed oil on proinflammatory cytokines and antioxidant activity in an acute acetic acid-induced colitis model in rats.
results_summary: Pomegranate seed oil significantly reduced total oxidant levels, nuclear factor kappa B, proinflammatory cytokines, and myeloperoxidase activity, while also reducing colitis injury, suggesting protective effects through antioxidant and anti-inflammatory mechanisms.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats with induced colitis.
effective_dosage: 0.4 ml/kg and 0.8 ml/kg pomegranate seed oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan (CS) combined with pomegranate seed oil (PO) in topical emulgels containing hydrocortisone, focusing on anti-inflammatory action and drug release behavior.
results_summary: The study found that CS/PO emulgels enhanced hydrocortisone release and anti-inflammatory effects, with the 6:4 CS/PO ratio being the most effective. PO contributed to hyaluronidase inhibition and improved anti-inflammatory performance, while CS modulated drug absorption.
population_specificity: Mouse fibroblasts (L929 cells) and in vitro models (no human subjects).
effective_dosage: CS/PO weight ratios varied, with the optimal ratio being 6:4 (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of pomegranate consumption on systolic and diastolic blood pressure in adults through a meta-analysis of randomized clinical trials.
results_summary: Pomegranate consumption significantly reduced both systolic and diastolic blood pressure, with greater reductions observed in individuals with higher baseline blood pressure. However, high heterogeneity among studies suggests variability in results.
population_specificity: Adults consuming pomegranate in various forms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update the pooled effect size of pomegranate juice supplementation on CRP levels in randomized controlled trials to assess its anti-inflammatory potential.
results_summary: Meta-analysis showed that pomegranate juice significantly reduced CRP levels, particularly in specific subgroups like individuals with type 2 diabetes, polycystic ovary syndrome, or those consuming <250 ml/day. The effect was consistent across different populations, but optimal dose and duration remain unclear.
population_specificity: Individuals of both sexes or only females, Iranian population, those aged 40+, with type 2 diabetes, or polycystic ovary syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anthelmintic effectiveness of a P. granatum macerate in sheep and assess its impact on milk production and quality.
results_summary: The P. granatum macerate showed considerable anthelmintic effectiveness (51.8%) and improved milk production quantitatively (15.5%) and qualitatively (higher protein, casein, lactose, and fat content).
population_specificity: Comisana pregnant sheep (pluripara at 20 days before parturition).
study_duration: Fecal sampling and AE evaluation were conducted up to D21; milk production was assessed up to DL84.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory potential of pomegranate-derived peptides (Pug-1 to Pug-4) against NTHi-induced inflammation, particularly in the context of COPD.
results_summary: Pug-4, a pomegranate-derived peptide, demonstrated potent anti-inflammatory effects by inhibiting NTHi-induced production of key inflammatory markers (IL-1β, TNF-α, NO, PGE2) and suppressing NF-κB signaling and NLRP3 inflammasome activation in multiple cell types. The study highlighted Pug-4 as a promising candidate for treating NTHi-mediated inflammation.
population_specificity: Murine (RAW264.7) and human (differentiated THP-1) macrophages, and human lung epithelial cells (A549).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to design novel anti-inflammatory compounds based on the pterostilbene skeleton and evaluate their activity and safety.
results_summary: Compound E2 demonstrated high anti-inflammatory activity (IC50 = 0.7 μM, outperforming celecoxib) by blocking the NF-κB/MAPK pathway and effectively alleviated acute colitis in mice.
population_specificity: Mice (in vivo experiments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to uncover the molecular interactions of pterostilbene with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) using in silico methods and identify potential therapeutic targets.
results_summary: The study identified differentially expressed genes (DEGs) in HCC and demonstrated pterostilbene's modulation of key signaling pathways, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic target for HCC.
population_specificity: In silico analysis using Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) datasets, focusing on hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pterostilbene (PTE) protects against oxidative stress injury in cardiomyocytes via the GAS6/Axl signaling pathway.
results_summary: PTE treatment improved cell viability, reduced oxidative stress and apoptosis, and enhanced mitochondrial function in H2O2-injured HL-1 cells, primarily through upregulation of the GAS6/Axl pathway. Molecular docking confirmed strong binding between PTE and GAS6.
population_specificity: HL-1 cardiomyocyte cell line (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of combined phloretin and pterostilbene (PP) treatment on inhibiting Colletotrichum gloeosporioides growth in vivo and explore its biocontrol mechanisms in stylo plants.
results_summary: PP treatment limited fungal growth, reduced oxidative stress, increased antioxidant levels, and protected chloroplast integrity, thereby alleviating anthracnose damage in stylo plants. Transcriptome analysis revealed significant gene expression changes related to oxidative stress and chloroplast organization.
population_specificity: Stylo plants infected with Colletotrichum gloeosporioides.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a pterostilbene nanoemulsion could improve bioavailability and neuroprotective effects compared to standard pterostilbene, particularly in enhancing learning and memory function.
results_summary: The pterostilbene nanoemulsion showed superior effects in improving learning and memory, protecting hippocampal neurons, and reducing apoptosis and oxidative stress compared to standard pterostilbene, likely due to enhanced activation of the nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely animal models, given behavioral tests like Y maze and water maze).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the antifibrotic effects of Pterostilbene (PTS) and explore its pharmacological mechanisms, pharmacokinetics, and toxicology for treating fibrosis.
results_summary: Pterostilbene demonstrated antifibrotic effects across multiple organ systems (myocardial, renal, pulmonary, hepatic, and colon fibrosis) by inhibiting inflammation, oxidative stress, and fibrogenesis through various signaling pathways. The study highlighted PTS's potential as a therapeutic agent for fibrosis.
population_specificity: In vivo and in vitro models (not human-specific).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pterostilbene could inhibit ferroptosis and rescue energy restriction induced by anticancer drugs in cardiomyoblast cells and rat hearts.
results_summary: Pterostilbene inhibited ferroptosis and restored energy production impaired by anticancer drugs in both in vitro and in vivo models, suggesting potential clinical applications for mitigating cardiotoxicity.
population_specificity: Rat cardiomyoblast H9c2 cells and cancer-free rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Pterostilbene (PTE) enhances the antitumor effects of various anticancer drugs in gastric cancer cells by increasing mitochondrial iron accumulation and reactive oxygen species.
results_summary: PTE combined with iron-accumulating anticancer drugs (doxorubicin and lapatinib) suppressed PDZD8 expression, increased mitochondrial iron and H2O2, and induced apoptosis via endoplasmic reticulum stress. No synergistic effect was observed with 5-fluorouracil or cisplatin.
population_specificity: Gastric cancer cells (in vitro study)
interactions: Synergistic effects noted with doxorubicin and lapatinib; no effect with 5-fluorouracil or cisplatin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the anti-proliferative activity of Pterostilbene analogues, particularly Tryptophan-conjugated compounds, in cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that Tryptophan-conjugated Pterostilbene analogues exhibited enhanced anti-proliferative activity and induced cellular stress pathways, including autophagy signaling, in breast cancer cells.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pharmacological properties, mechanisms of action, and therapeutic potential of Pterostilbene (PTS) for treating inflammatory and oncological diseases.
results_summary: Pterostilbene exhibits anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antitumour properties, with a favorable pharmacokinetic profile and better oral bioavailability compared to other stilbenoids. However, more clinical trials are needed to confirm its safety and efficacy in diverse populations.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)
